results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 139
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Perpendicular architecture: a tent designed for mountaineers who spend their dormitory hours hanging from the vertical faces of mountains. Burns hoverbed: a new treatment for burns, a bed which supports the patient on air by the hover principle. Resins and foam: quick setting resins react with water to set hard; expanding foams fill potentially dangerous cracks in cable ducts, as part of a fire protection system for power stations.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 138
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: A 6 ft high roadside thermometer turns white when freezing temperatures prevail warning motorists of less than favourable driving conditions; the chemical industries mechanical jungles of tangled metalwork are being replaced by installations where you can see exactly what is going on giving greater control and safety; an electric wheelchair, designed to give “go-anywhere” mobility to the disabled can climb steps up to 5 inches high and climb slopes of up to 1 in 2.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 136
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: The development of a combination microwave/convection oven; precision timber cutting with the aid of a computer; capping children’s molars with acrylic to prevent decay; intercontinental air shipping using the “flying fridge” insulated freight container.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 135
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: A little machine deals with dirty glasses - it washes, dries and sterilises them at the rate of one every three seconds; severly disabled people can drive around like the rest of us by steering by foot; a working model of the solar system illuminates and illustrates many of the mysteries of astronomy; research at St Andrew’s University into the survival mechanisms of the human cell, is revealing something of the complex ways in which they work.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 133
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Engineers compete with the elements to produce five million volts of man-made lightning and the feasibility of transmitting electricity at this huge voltage; a machine has been developed to take oil, hydraulic and brake-fluid, rubber, fuel and grit from surfaces of motorways; severely handicapped children are helped by projection of colored patterns.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 131
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: A diving suit which looks more like a space suit allows a diver to breathe air at normal pressure, eat his lunch in comfort and manipulate tools with special flexible arms as well as stay down at considerable depths for a whole day; the resources of a design with the latest equipment are taking the guess work out of the design of boat building; a free flooking submersible which gives the skin diver a whale of a time - he can travel for 80 kilometres underwater at up to seven knots.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 130
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: “Speedaway” is a fast travelling walkway system which could soon be speeding pedestrians across our cities; a new extrusion process puts new tread on old tyres, moulding liquid rubber direct on to the casing; the Neo-Natometer is a simple but effective means for measuring a baby’s length; out of one suitcase come the basic modules which assemble into an armchair - these modules can easily be cut into new shapes and anything from a wardrobe to a dining table can be constructed from them.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 128
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: The “Dry-Flo” process for reclaiming the scrap copper in old cables in which copper granules are separated from the insulation in a stream of iron fillings; the development of a baby in early pregnancy can bring anxiety to the mother - Ultrasound produces pictures of the inside of the womb and is used to make sure that evrything is progressing normally; a length of bamboo and a smooth round pebble make a pump in a rice field in Southeast Asia - updated and motorised, this simple pump is finding applications in modern industry; a new oil filter removes virtually all contaminants from engine oil - its secret is a roll of very fine fibre.
results.description: Cinemagazine items: The “Dry-Flo” process for reclaiming the scrap copper in old cables in which copper granules are separated from the insulation in a stream of iron fillings; the development of a baby in early pregnancy can bring anxiety to the mother - Ultrasound produces pictures of the inside of the womb and is used to make sure that evrything is progressing normally; a length of bamboo and a smooth round pebble make a pump in a rice field in Southeast Asia - updated and motorised, this simple pump is finding applications in modern industry; a new oil filter removes virtually all contaminants from engine oil - its secret is a roll of very fine fibre.

results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 127
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: An entirely new concept in Aviaries provides tropical birds in the north of England with the right environment; carbon dioxide is used to isolate fault sections in a water supply system needing repair - also see a simple way to prevent pipes that may freeze in the winter from bursting; a new artificial leg which automatically telescopes at the knee helps the user to walk naturally.
